result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary M. ST. JOHN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, defendant entered a plea in Case File 14 CF 263.  Motion granted.  
Minutes

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 10-02-2014 @ 9:00 a.m. BR-3.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-15-14 at 9:30 a.m.  
Defense counsel notes there is a mistake n the criminal complaint, the three prior violations in the history are not this defendant's.  State moves to remove the previous history from the complaint.  Motion granted.  
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-13-14 at 1:45 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-11-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
